intro: Calanthe uncata, commonly known as the naked leek orchid, is a rare and elegant orchid species native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, leek-like leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in cool, moist environments, often in forested areas with rich, well-drained soil. Calanthe uncata is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in high-altitude habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species in some regions.
